content: May 4 (Reuters) - British investment platform Hargreaves Lansdown Plc reported on Thursday a jump in its assets under administration(AUA) for a three-month period, after an increase in its net new business on the back of a revival in investor sentiment.

The London-listed company reported net new business of 1.6 billion pounds ($2.01 billion) for the three-month period ended March 31, and AUA of 132 billion pounds, compared with 127.1 billion pounds seen at December-end.($1 = 0.7942 pounds)(Reporting by Sinchita Mitra and Radhika Anilkumar in Bengaluru; Editing by Sherry Jacob-Phillips)
